attributes.contentHtml:
Let me answer this real quick.

1) It is okay to use hetzner auction server and set the ram to 128gb or upper. It depends on the processing power if they can handle the amount of server or not.
2) They are just dumb, they should use calculator instead of using 2000 MB (1.72 GB) if they put 2048 MB (2.00 GB) You will get the resource u bought. Same answers with storage too!
3) Well.. about the storage issues, is it alot already for small servers. But, if you really need high storage you gotta request one.
Well im not gonna complain about the price since it matches already with the plans.
4) If they got a lot of freaking grammar/spelling mistakes, then they are a kid who owns a hosting. And yeah about the privacy policy. "DaryNodes have rights to erase anyone's data without any information or update given to the community" its absolutely ridiculous and its making people mad.

This hosting is really not recommended.
Also, give me the server invite link. I will spy on the host till the thread is done.

iiChxrlly_ ah!! Bro u are right on that ram . i will use calculater but in vc customer force us to give some extra ram for showing their friends etc etc. so we did and u can ask customer that we don't have any storage restrictions. if they demand for 100gb storage we are ready to provide and while any client buy a service from us we ask them how much storage do u need. most of them said give us 10 gb or 20 when it will full u may increase it. and as akshay share the ss here. do u know we gave that YT a 10 gb bungee server with bot protection in free when he purchase a 6gb ram service. u may come to discord for proof. ü§û
iiChxrlly_ and akshay get ban from DaryNode as he always ddos me amd try to divert the customer to play in his SMP . üòê

iiChxrlly_ they're not dumb, they're promising 1GB which equates to 1000MB, if they were to promise 1GiB then it'd make sense that they allocate 1024MB.

I wonder if it's really NVMe tho, since it's a auctioned metal from hetzner it most likely has an SSD or a repurposed NVMe at the least, Best not to offer storage plans with that. Most big-medium providers have big pools of which they allocate storage to their users.

Since it's a summer host, the spelling mistakes should be ignored anyways. Seriously?
